alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 15 at 9:21AM MST until December 15 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow showers will gradually decrease through the rest of the day. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph above timberline and the eastern slope of the Front Range with blowing snow and poor visibilities. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, and The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility. Roads will be snow covered and slick this morning. The hazardous conditions should gradually improve through the afternoon as snow decreases.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org
